title: Man Utd fans totally confused by Jose Mourinho’s formation and where Eric Bailly is playing
text:
Eric Bailly in action at the Riverside (Getty) Manchester United fans were left perplexed by Jose Mourinho’s team selection and formation for the Premier League encounter with Middlesbrough on Sunday.
Having named Eric Bailly, Chris Smalling and Phil Jones in his side it was thought Mourinho was persisting with the three at the back he used in the Europa League in midweek. The selection of Antonio Valencia and Ashley Young gave the theory additional credence with the pair adept to play as wing-backs.
Man City v Man Utd has finally been rescheduled However, once the game kicked off it often appeared that Bailly was playing as a right-back in a back four with Valencia playing right midfield.
Bailly immediately looked confused about his positioning and those watching were just as baffled, particular with right-back Matteo Darmian on the bench. Timothy Fosu-Mensah, also among the substitutes at the Riverside, could have played in the position and Ashley Young could have been utilised on the right instead of the left.

Mourinho’s team selection was badly hampered by injuries and suspensions. Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Ander Herrera missed the game due to suspension and Wayne Rooney and Paul Pogba were unavailable due to injuries. Anthony Martial was also not considered ready to start the game after fitness issues of his own while Henrikh Mkhitaryan was also on the bench.
